quest.name: Trail of Skulls
journal: The blasphemy hunter may seem calm and collected from a distance, but you suspect something is amiss.

The blasphemy hunter reports that Fordola has given her keepers the slip and disappeared during a training exercise. Apparently, she has been acting out of sorts ever since meeting the mother and daughter you had previously encountered in Ala Gannha, so Raubahn has gone there in search of clues as to her whereabouts.

From speaking with the mother and child, you learn that Fordola was overwhelmed by a vision granted to her by the Echo during their meeting. It appears she witnessed the young girl's memories of a man she met moments before he transformed into the blasphemy you seek. Fordola was heard to utter the name “Charlet,” and though it is unfamiliar to your present company, Raganfrid may have useful information to share.

Raganfrid explains that Charlet is an Ala Mhigan with ties to the Empire, and his older brother Ansfrid served under Fordola in the Crania Lupi. Fortunately, Raganfrid happens to know their uncle, who he recently helped find work at the Sleeping Stones, and he should be able to assist you in your inquiries.

Charlet's uncle relates to you the tale of his two nephews, both of whom were raised as imperial citizens. They were also childhood friends of Fordola's, and while Ansfrid joined the army, Charlet's compassionate demeanor made him unsuited to a life in the military. After learning of the deaths of his brother and the other Skulls, he blamed himself for abandoning his friends and eventually disappeared. As the pieces of the puzzle come together, you ponder the bigger picture as you make your way back to Ala Gannha.

You share your findings with Arenvald, in particular the link between Charlet and Fordola. It occurs to Arenvald that she is likely attempting to put down the blasphemy that her friend has become out of the belief that she is responsible for its creation.

Back in the Ala Mhigan Quarter, Raubahn details his two-pronged approach to tracking down Charlet and Fordola. It stands to reason that if one is found, the other will not be far behind, and you decide it best to bide your time until fresh information comes to light.

※The next role quest will be available from the blasphemy hunter upon reaching level 90 in any healer class.
objectives: Speak with Raubahn in Ala Gannha.
Speak with Raubahn in the Ala Mhigan Quarter.

dialogue.name: LIVERATIONARMY
dialogue.text: Something terrible has happened!

dialogue.name: LIVERATIONARMY
dialogue.text: It's Fordola─she's escaped!

dialogue.name: LIVERATIONARMY
dialogue.text: She was accompanying a squadron out on a training exercise. One moment she was there, and the next, she was gone!

dialogue.name: LIVERATIONARMY
dialogue.text: I didn't think much of it at the time, but she's been acting strangely ever since she went to meet that mother and child. You know, the ones who wanted to thank her for saving the girl's life.

dialogue.name: LIVERATIONARMY
dialogue.text: When I told Commander Aldynn about it, he went charging off to Ala Gannha to ask them if they have any idea where Fordola might be.

dialogue.name: LIVERATIONARMY
dialogue.text: I thought about going after him, but when I heard you were headed this way, I reckoned it'd be better to send you in my stead. Godsspeed, Forename!

dialogue.name: LIVERATIONARMY
dialogue.text: Fordola's an enigma at the best of times. I'm sure she's got her reasons, but I haven't the slightest clue what they could be...

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Gods be good─ What is she thinking?

dialogue.name: CLARELL
dialogue.text: Have we done something wrong?

dialogue.name: LYLIE
dialogue.text: I know you! You're friends with the brave lady, aren't you?

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Forename? I wasn't expecting to see you here. You've heard what's happened, then?

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Just as Fordola was beginning to earn our trust, she's given us the slip. As you may know, she wears a choker enchanted to prevent exactly that.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: If I were to give the order, she would be dead within moments─and she knows that. She took the risk anyway, so I have to believe she has a good reason.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: That's what we're looking into now.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: We were hoping Clarell and young Lylie here could shed some light on the matter.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: We'd like to ask you about your conversation with Fordola, if we may.

dialogue.name: CLARELL
dialogue.text: (-Clarell-)Yes...of course.

dialogue.name: CLARELL
dialogue.text: (-Clarell-)I know she's the Butcher─or was, at least─but it didn't seem right to go without thanking her. That's why I requested the meeting. To express my gratitude...and my apologies.

dialogue.name: CLARELL
dialogue.text: (-Clarell-)She was quiet at first. Just stood there as we spoke, as if she weren't even listening. And then I mentioned the blasphemy, and she looked at Lylie...and all of a sudden clutched her own head and cried out in agony!

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: The Echo...

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Can you remember what you were thinking about at the time?

dialogue.name: LYLIE
dialogue.text: (-Lylie-)Umm... A man. The one I saw in the city.

dialogue.name: CLARELL
dialogue.text: (-Clarell-)What? Who? Did he have something to do with all those people panicking?

dialogue.name: LYLIE
dialogue.text: (-Lylie-)I think he did... When I was waiting for you, I saw him. He was by himself...

dialogue.name: LYLIE
dialogue.text: (-Lylie-)He looked poorly, so I asked if he was all right, and he said yes. He had a nice smile.

dialogue.name: LYLIE
dialogue.text: (-Lylie-)He got up and started walking. B-But then...

dialogue.name: LYLIE
dialogue.text: (-Lylie-)He was shouting and screaming! I was so frightened, I didn't want to talk about it. Not even to Mum.

dialogue.name: CLARELL
dialogue.text: (-Clarell-)I wish you'd said something sooner! <sigh> I'm sorry, poppet. This is my fault for leaving you on your own...

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: The man who turned into a blasphemy, I'd wager. The girl saw him─which means Fordola has now seen him, too.

dialogue.name: CLARELL
dialogue.text: (-Clarell-)There was one other thing. When Fordola was having her, ah...funny turn, she said something. Charlie? No... Charlet, I think. Yes, that was it.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Ring any bells?

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Can't say it does. But if he has anything to do with the Skulls, the Silver Griffins should have some information on him.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: We'd best have a word with Raganfrid, then.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: You've both been very helpful. I'd also like to thank you for being so kind to Fordola. She may not have said it, but I'm sure it meant a lot to her.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: I've a couple more things I'd like to ask, so I'll catch up with you later.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Whatever she's dealing with, she needn't face it alone. I wish I could've told her that...even though I know she probably wouldn't have listened.

dialogue.name: CLARELL
dialogue.text: Fordola may well be everything people say she is─or worse─but she did us a good turn that day. I'll never forget it.

dialogue.name: LYLIE
dialogue.text: Where did the brave lady go?

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I've a feeling this Charlet and Fordola are connected in some way.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: Charlet, you say? Yes, that name came up during our recent investigations...

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: As I recall, he served under the viceroy during the occupation, and his whereabouts is currently unknown. Had an older brother, named Ansfrid, one of the Crania Lupi.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Which would give him a connection to Fordola... Is there anyone who can tell us more about him?

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: Yes, an uncle, who we recently helped find employment here in Ala Gannha. He's actually the one who asked us to look for Charlet.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: You'll most likely find him working at the Sleeping Stones. As it happens, I was planning to bring him something to eat. I'll join you there shortly.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: You might think a quarry is no place for a man of advanced years, and perhaps you'd be right. But hard times are the only times we've known, even before the occupation, and I doubt that'll change much within my lifetime.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Perhaps we should've asked what he looks like...

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: Still looking, eh? That's him, over there.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: I hope we're not interrupting.

dialogue.name: RELATIVESMAN04112
dialogue.text: No, no, of course not! It's good to see you, Raganfrid.

dialogue.name: RELATIVESMAN04112
dialogue.text: My word, the Bull of Ala Mhigo and the champion of the Alliance. What brings such esteemed guests to our humble, err...quarry?

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: At ease, my good fellow. We merely wish to ask you about your nephew.

dialogue.name: RELATIVESMAN04112
dialogue.text: Charlet!? You've found him!?

dialogue.name: RELATIVESMAN04112
dialogue.text: No luck yet, then.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: Is there anything else you can tell us? More about his childhood, perhaps.

dialogue.name: RELATIVESMAN04112
dialogue.text: Wasn't much of one, I'm afraid... Poor boy's life was ruined long before he had any say in the matter. His parents and I swore allegiance to Garlemald to secure ourselves and our kin citizenship. For all the good it did us here, living amongst our countrymen who treated us as pariahs.

dialogue.name: RELATIVESMAN04112
dialogue.text: Took its toll on him and his brother, to be spat on as traitors by association. One thing led to another, and Ansfrid─together with most of his friends─joined the imperial army. That's how it started, you know. The Crania Lupi. Gaius's loyal little pups...

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Do you remember the names of these friends?

dialogue.name: RELATIVESMAN04112
dialogue.text: Yes, they had quite the reputation growing up. There was Emelin, Hrudolf...

dialogue.name: RELATIVESMAN04112
dialogue.text: ...And the angry little girl who'd grow up to become the Butcher herself, Fordola.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: Charlet was part of their group, too, yes? But from what we've heard, he chose not to become a soldier.

dialogue.name: RELATIVESMAN04112
dialogue.text: Wouldn't have lasted a day in training. He knew that better than anyone, of course. Not that it helped him to feel any less guilty for “turning his back” on the others.

dialogue.name: RELATIVESMAN04112
dialogue.text: He blamed himself for their deaths. For not stopping them when he had the chance. For not being strong enough to fight by their side. Maybe save them, maybe not─but he wasn't there, and he wished he had been. Then one day, he was gone.

dialogue.name: RELATIVESMAN04112
dialogue.text: Wherever he is, I hope he's safe and well.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: So do we. Thank you─the information you've shared should prove useful. And for you, I've brought some food. Why don't you call it a day and go and enjoy it with your family?

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: Let him have the peace for now. Back to Ala Gannha.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: Once we know for certain what has become of Charlet, we'll have to tell his uncle.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: That little girl's worried about Fordola. As for the mother...well, it's complicated. Understandable, really.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: ...So not only was his brother a member of the Skulls, but Charlet himself was a childhood friend of Fordola's.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: I'm told he refused the support of the Silver Griffins as well. He's been trying to make his own way for some time now.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: His brother and his friends died at Specula Imperatoris─save for Fordola, and the gods only know how he felt about her after that.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Or how Fordola felt about Charlet after seeing Lylie's memory of him transforming into a blasphemy. Brother of a man she killed and a childhood friend besides─she thinks she's responsible for this. That's why she ran. To kill the beast.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: I never thought I'd say this, but...I'm worried about her.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: Fordola is a survivor and an outcast herself─exactly the sort of person the Silver Griffins are trying to support.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: You've seen for yourself the sacrifices she's willing to make. And if you can learn to feel sympathy for her, maybe others can, too.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I think we have enough information for the time being. Let's return to the city and plan our next move.

dialogue.name: ARENVALD
dialogue.text: As the saying goes, “history is written by the victor.” And I'll wager those who swore loyalty to Garlemald never thought they'd find themselves on the losing side. But they did, and they paid a price. Maybe not enough for some, but we've got to draw a line somewhere.

dialogue.name: RAGANFRID
dialogue.text: To some, Fordola is a monster worse than any blasphemy. But I've seen enough working with the Silver Griffins to realize it's never that simple. I want to believe there's hope for her─that there's hope for us all.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: I've assigned a few of my soldiers to assist the Silver Griffins in investigating Charlet's background.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: With luck, we will find him quickly. And then we can prepare for what must come after.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: We're all but certain Charlet's the one who transformed into a blasphemy, and so there's naught to be done but put him out of his misery.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: As for Fordola, I've put M'naago and her troops in charge of tracking her. Once they've found her, they have my permission to lend whatever support they deem necessary.

dialogue.name: RAUBAHN
dialogue.text: If it comes to it, I may ask you to join the search. Until such time, I ask that you take this opportunity to rest.

dialogue.name: LIVERATIONARMY
dialogue.text: It would be quite a blow for us to lose a warrior of Fordola's caliber. I hope we can find her before she does anything stupid.
